**2023 Blackstone, Private Wealth Solutions Summer Analyst**

**Job Title**

Summer Analyst

**Business Unit**

Private Wealth Solutions

**Business Unit Overview**

Private Wealth Solutions was established to answer the growing demand for Blackstone products from high-net worth investors. Partnering with many of the world’s largest private banks and wealth management firms. Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions team packages and delivers the full breadth of Blackstone’s alternative product capability to these firms and their clients and provides ongoing product and advisor support, as well as education and training around alternatives.

**Program Description**

Blackstone's Summer Analyst Program is a 10 week in-person experience, offering participants extensive exposure across the firm. This program provides Summer Analysts with valuable guidance through mentorship, continuous feedback, technical and soft skill training, networking opportunities with professionals across the firm, and the unique chance to fully immerse themselves in Blackstone's culture.

**Job Description**

Blackstone’s Private Wealth Solutions (PWS) Summer Analyst program is a unique experience among financial firms, enabling analysts to gain exposure to aspects of the private wealth industry. The Summer Analyst role is focused on supporting several areas of PWS in capacities ranging from fund development and capital raising to product management and business analytics.

**Key Responsibilities Include:**

- Supporting our client management teams with fund due diligence, onboarding, market intelligence, and fund raising.
- Analyzing business/market trends and providing targeted prospecting guidance to sales and service teams.
- Performing analyses and assisting with financial reporting of PWS’s results to senior management.
- Conduct research on product structures, regulatory developments and competitor fund launches to help identify scale opportunities.
- Analyze competitive landscape through reviewing peers’ filing documents, presentations, etc., and distill key qualitative and quantitative takeaways.
- Creating and managing updates for marketing materials used within the business.
- Supporting the learning & development platform, global programs, and company culture initiatives for PWS employees.

**Qualifications**

Blackstone seeks to hire individuals who work well in a team-driven working group, are highly motivated, intelligent, have sound judgment and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors. 

To be considered for the 2026 Summer Analyst Program, applicants must meet the following criteria:

- Currently enrolled as an undergraduate student
- Anticipated graduation date: Fall 2026 – Spring 2027
- Resume must include expected graduation month/year and GPA
- Resume must be in PDF format

If you do not meet these criteria, please see Blackstone’s Careers website for other opportunities that may be available, including other entry level positions.

  
The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position.  Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.

coverLetter:
March 23rd, 2023
To Whom It May Concern,

I am writing to express my interest in the Summer Analyst position at Rothschild & Co.'s Chicago office. As a candidate pursuing a Masters in Public Policy at the University of Chicago’s Harris School of Public Policy, expecting to graduate in June 2024, I am confident that my academic background, quantitative and analytical skills, and policy expertise make me an ideal candidate for this role.

My studies have focused on the confluence of finance and policy and the interplay of politics and the economy, with relevant coursework including Corporate Finance, Applied Financial Management, Microeconomics for Public Policy, and Macroeconomic Policymaking. These courses have given me a familiarity with the myriad factors influencing investment performance, as well as an intimate understanding of how financial institutions and corporations function to generate value. The MPP program’s focus on quantitative rigor has also allowed me to develop many technical competencies, including statistical analysis, research, data-driven decision-making, strategic thinking, and project evaluation.

Policy analysis and investment evaluation share common principles and approaches, including the use of cost-benefit calculations, an objective data-driven approach to weighing decisions, and the imperative to make decisions without perfect information and manage risk by preparing for contingencies. Beyond these similarities, my background in public policy also provides me with an intuitive grasp of the reflexive dynamic between markets and the government, and a unique perspective that broadens the diversity of opinions to improve the decision-making process.

As a business analyst intern at Bainbridge Consulting, I deepened my understanding of business development and valuation, applying these concepts to craft a business strategy as a consultant to an event-planning software startup seeking to grow their operations and reach new customers. Using market research and surveys of target consumers, my team helped the client identify their competitive niche and formulate a business plan for achieving their growth targets. My responsibilities entailed reading the client’s financial statements, creating financial models forecasting the strategy’s impact on the firm’s operations (based on certain assumptions), and conducting scenario and sensitivity analyses to assess performance under different outcomes. These findings were incorporated into the project deliverable, which provided a comprehensive view of the client’s market positioning, outlined their core competencies and competitive advantage, and suggested a strategy for meeting their growth objective based on our models. Throughout the eight weeks of the project, I learned much about the essential attributes of effective leadership and teamwork, which often entails treating all members as equals and valuing their input.

This experience also gave me a deeper appreciation for the nuances of financial modeling, including how data analysis can be leveraged to improve the accuracy of cash flow projections, as well as the importance of scenario planning in helping firms prepare for the unexpected and mitigate risk. At Rothschild & Co., I hope to continue learning and grow both personally and professionally in a rigorous and meritocratic environment where profits and losses are tied to the quality of one’s work.

I also had the opportunity to develop these skills in a professional environment as a Risk and Financial Advisory Intern at Deloitte’s San Diego office, working with an international bank on handling transactions. The client project entailed conducting due diligence checks on the bank’s counterparties, ensuring compliance with anti-money laundering regulations, and assessing tax obligations in various jurisdictions. My responsibilities included building models assessing foreign currency risk to guide the client’s loan decisions and conducting scenario analyses for the bank’s balance sheets under different contingencies. This experience gave me a close-up look at how financial institutions conduct transactions and manage risk, experience with modeling, scenario analysis, and valuations, and experience working effectively in a team to meet project milestones.

A past internship as a Risk and Financial Advisory Analyst at Deloitte’s San Diego office during my penultimate year of university also gave me early exposure to different parts of the financial system and allowed me to gain real-world experience working effectively in a team environment to solve a client’s problem. My responsibilities included performing due diligence checks on high-risk clients for an international bank, helping them mitigate risk, and helping ensure compliance with anti-money laundering laws across multiple jurisdictions. I also built financial models in Excel to help the client weigh strategic decisions, taking care to note the potential risks of each option and how best to mitigate them. The client presentation my team and I put together helped inform the bank’s decision, laying out forecasts under different scenarios of each choice through financial models we built in Excel and taking care to note the potential risks attendant with each decision and how best to mitigate them. This experience gave me a close-up look at how financial institutions conduct transactions and manage risk, experience with modeling, scenario analysis, and valuations, and experience working collaboratively to tackle complex problems by breaking them into component parts and delegating tasks effectively to ensure smooth progress throughout the project.

My strengths in the fields of both finance and policy give me a unique perspective and an intuitive grasp of their reflexive influences on each other, which will enable me to excel in a position where the ability to translate both quantitative and qualitative inputs into useful information is of crucial importance. I am currently completing the first year of my two-year MPP Program at UChicago, where my studies have focused on the confluence of finance and public policy and how private firms, such as financial institutions, have evolved to meet the needs of today’s world and to increase their resilience to the risks of the future. Through courses in Corporate Finance, Applied Financial Management, and Macroeconomic Policymaking, I gained a wide-ranging mastery of the broad factors influencing the performance of investments, as well as an intimate understanding of how financial institutions and corporations function on a micro level to create value. Through the program’s heavy quantitative focus, I have acquired a strong foundation in statistical analysis, research, data-driven decision-making, strategic planning, financial analysis and valuation, as well as expertise in policy matters. My strengths in both the financial and policy aspects make me a strong candidate, I believe, for a position where projecting future investment returns amidst uncertainty is the bread and butter of the firm’s business.

While at Harris, I was also able to participate in the International Strategic Crisis Negotiation Exercise, leading the Indonesian delegation in negotiations over disputed claims in the South China Sea. This experience strengthened my strategic thinking skills and gave me greater insight into the means by which one’s desired end goals can be attained in negotiations with parties with diametrically opposed positions, which often involves understanding the other side’s desired end goals and acceptable compromises and modeling their behavior to predict their most likely positions and strategies. My responsibilities as team leader involved coordinating meetings, delegating tasks, and devising negotiation strategies. Furthermore, as team leader, I gained valuable experience in achieving one’s desired outcomes in negotiations with parties with seemingly intractable differences — assets that I believe are important to a business where policy decisions and unforeseen risks are a part of everyday life.

Furthermore, a strong understanding of the policymaking process and the strategic interactions of different groups is of increasing importance as financial institutions like your own take on greater responsibility for the environments in which they operate and give more attention to the wide range of stakeholders impacted by their operations. Among the many technical competencies I developed through the quantitatively focused MPP program are statistical analysis, research, data-driven decision-making, strategic thinking, and project evaluation. I hope to put these skills to good use as an analyst at Rothschild & Co., where my familiarity with the worlds of both finance and policy gives me a unique perspective that I believe will enable me to excel.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Roger Lin

Apply for 2026 Global Markets Summer Associate, Equity Research job with Royal Bank of Canada in New York, New York, United States of America. Customer Service | Client Advice | Sales at Royal Bank of Canada

**WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?**

RBC Capital Markets is a premier, global investment bank and subsidiary of the Royal Bank of Canada (RBC), which is one of the top 15 largest banks in the world and the fifth largest in North America, as measured by market capitalization.

RBC Capital Markets is a premier investment bank that provides a focused set of products and services to corporations, institutional investors and governments around the world. With more than 7,100 professionals, we operate out of 70 offices in 15 countries across North America, the U.K., Europe, and the Asia-Pacific region.

We work with clients in over 100 countries around the globe to deliver the expertise and execution required to raise capital, access markets, mitigate risk and acquire or dispose of assets. According to Bloomberg and Dealogic, we are consistently ranked among the largest global investment banks.

## **Summer Research Program**

Our Equity Research Summer Associate internship provides students with practical training, hands-on capital markets experience and career-building mentorship throughout the ten-week program. Every year we recruit successful applicants into our regional offices for many research sectors. Successful applicants will be assigned to one of many research sectors (TMT, Consumer, Healthcare, Energy, Financials, etc.) for the duration of the program in a selected regional office.

## **WHAT WILL YOU DO?**

You will have the opportunity to work directly with an established Equity Research Analyst and team of associates covering a specific equity sector. Throughout the summer you will also have the opportunity to hear and learn from senior leaders across RBC Capital Markets, expanding your knowledge base and network. Some specific tasks you may be assigned include:

• Building and maintaining complex financial models and equity valuation tools

• Researching and staying up-to-date with industry trends

• Contributing to day-to-day production of research content and longer-term projects

## **WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?**

Each candidate will be evaluated on their individual merit; however, it is a definite asset to possess the following qualifications:

• Excellent grades in a four-year US college or university program and entering the final year upon completion of the program, or entering the final year of MBA studies upon completion of the program;

• Proven interest in financial markets;

• History of academic excellence;

• Strong analytical and interpersonal skills

• Track record of leadership experience outside the classroom

We seek competitive individuals who possess the energy, enthusiasm and capacity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Successful candidates are selected based on their related capital markets work experience, market knowledge, financial analysis prowess, academic excellence, and strong communication skills. Candidates need to be confident in their personal capabilities but willing to learn and do what it takes to complete a task.

**WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?**

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, think progressively, continue our growth, and deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our individual/collective potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

From this experience you would gain:

·       Hands-on experience working alongside equity research analysts and associates who are among the best in the industry

·       Best in class training which include orientation sessions as well an in-class curriculum and regular information sessions with key business leaders

·       Direct exposure to the different areas of the capital markets

·       An understanding of RBC Capital Markets’ global capabilities

·       Unique exposure to and experience in international markets

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $110,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs. RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

jobDescription:
Postgraduate Consultant Program

https://harris-uchicago-csm.symplicity.com/students/app/jobs/detail/1ef1a63f69e17b7c83c8f194e22bc257?expired=1	

### Job Description

**ABOUT DALBERG**  
We are a global group working to build a more inclusive and sustainable world where all people, everywhere, can reach their fullest potential. We partner with and serve communities, governments, and companies throughout the world, providing an innovative mix of advisory, investment, research, analytics, and design services. Today’s complex global problems require new solutions. Comprised of Dalberg Advisors, Dalberg Data Insights, Dalberg Design, Dalberg Implement, Dalberg Media, Dalberg Research, and a not-for-profit, Dalberg Catalyst, our businesses approach problems differently and work together to create impact at scale. We are from everywhere, at home anywhere - an African and American company as much as an Asian, Latin American, Middle Eastern, and European one.

Dalberg is a place where a diverse mix of talented individuals are able to bring their authentic selves to work – whether it’s how you identify, where you come from, the languages you speak, the person you love, or the way you worship. Dalberg is a home where people feel safe, understood, nurtured, and encouraged to grow.

As a team of 700+ people from 55 countries, speaking over 90 languages collectively, with a 40% female leadership team, Dalberg places diversity, equity and inclusion principles at the heart of our organization and the work we do alongside our clients, partners and communities.

Established in 2001 by experienced private sector consultants, Dalberg operates from 30 worldwide locations. For more information, please visit Dalberg.

**ABOUT YOU**

- You aspire to become a leader in global development by tackling global issues, from malnutrition to climate change to economic inequality, ensuring no population is left behind.
- You enjoy working hard and collaborating with teams across continents and cultures. You are a problem-solver and excel at clear strategic thinking and quantitative and qualitative analysis, and you want to hone these skills and put them to work – transforming organizations, advising investors, and shaping new initiatives.
- You are an entrepreneur that is ready to jump in and help us take our firm to the next level. You have been a top performer in your previous career. You are passionate about development.

Dalberg has a global footprint with consultants that live and work around the world, creating a network of local experience anchored by our offices in Africa, Asia, Europe, MENA and the Americas. Dalberg combines ground-level insight with experience from top-tier professional services firms and leading academic institutions to create actionable solutions to the world’s most pressing issues.

**Qualifications**

- Full-time graduate student getting an MBA, MPA, MPP, and/or other similar degrees with expected graduation dates of May/June 2024, or May/June 2023 for one-year graduate programs.
- Excellent academic record.
- Experience working in a leading international management consultancy firm, financial services firm or similar type of private sector experience; or experience working in a strategic role for a high-performing social or public-sector organization.
- Strong analytical abilities, both quantitative and qualitative.
- Ability to present information in an insightful and structured manner, both written and oral.
- Demonstrated ability to bring big ideas to life, build impact-oriented enterprises, and lead teams to accomplish ambitious goals.
- Understanding of the political and cultural environments of international organizations or environments.
- In addition, if you have skills or abilities in the following areas, please be sure to let us know in your application:Fluency in spoken and written languages other than English.
- Experience with financial analysis, excel, STATA.
- In-depth knowledge on specific topics related to Dalberg’s work.
- Demonstrated ability to innovate new programs, ideas, or initiatives.

**WHAT YOU WILL DO AND HOW YOU WILL GROW**  
You will drive the creation of innovative and results-oriented solutions for Dalberg’s clients – helping us change the development landscape around the world. Dalberg Postgraduate Consultants take ownership of key aspects of the client’s challenges, initiate critical and creative thinking on these strategic issues, lead research and complicated analyses and contribute to developing our relationships with clients.

Examples of recent projects that Dalberg consultants have worked on include creating a macro-economic plan for the Government of Ethiopia to accelerate industrial growth, designing a major foundation’s strategy to control sleeping sickness in Democratic Republic of the Congo and neighboring countries, and launching a new impact investment fund for agriculture in Nigeria. In addition, Dalberg Consultants worked on creating the world’s largest public, freely available dataset on national digital ID in India and have previously traveled for work to a mine in a jungle in Indonesia, to refugee camps in remote parts of Kenya, and to the border of Nepal looking at trafficking transport chains.

Dalberg is a platform for change. Our staff is empowered to start new programs, institute best practices, and develop traditions that will define the Dalberg experience for years to come. Innovation and entrepreneurship are not only valued at Dalberg; they are essential to our success. In addition to providing training, management-level advising, and mentoring, we empower Dalberg Postgraduate Consultants to learn by doing, engaging them as full members of project teams from day one.

The Dalberg Postgraduate Consultant Program, which is 10-12 weeks long, is one of the primary paths to full-time employment for Postgraduate Consultants at Dalberg Advisors. As a Postgraduate Consultant, you will get the opportunity to better understand what it would be like to work at Dalberg full-time, and we will have the opportunity to get to know you. Postgraduate Consultants will be considered for full-time offers to join the firm after graduation. Please note that applicants must be enrolled in a full-time graduate school program with an expected graduation date of May/June 2024 or May/June 2023 for one-year graduate programs.

**ABOUT OUR CLIENTS**  
Our clients come to us with some of the most difficult global problems, seeking solutions where the obvious ones have failed. We are entrepreneurs and innovators, designers and creative problem solvers, thinkers, and doers who supply new ideas, drawing from a deep base of knowledge that cuts across sectors and geographies and is growing every day. We partner with and serve communities, governments, and companies throughout the world. Some of our recent clients include foundations such as the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, corporations such as Pepsi and Vodafone, multilateral institutions such as the World Bank and the Inter-American Development Bank, UN agencies such as UNICEF and the UNEP, and government agencies such as the Ethiopian Ministry of Innovation and Technology, USAID, and India’s NITI Aayog.

**JOIN OUR TEAM- Application Details**  
Our current opportunities are in Dar es Salaam, Kigali, Mumbai, New Delhi and Singapore.

Please submit your application at our Career Centre, by 11:59 EST on January 15, 2023.

**In your cover letter,** please list up to 3 offices – only for locations where the position is open – where you hope to work and to be considered for a full-time position, in order of preference. When considering location preferences: if extended an offer for full-time employment after graduation, Postgraduate Consultants will be offered a role in the office they were based only. **Remember: full-time employment in all the Dalberg offices is conditional on the candidate having the requisite authorization to live and work in that country.**

Your application should include a resume noting current GMAT and / or GRE scores as applicable, cover letter, and a written response (limited to 500 words) that answers ONE of the following questions. The intention of this writing exercise is for us to get a sense of your writing style, as well as what most excites you. Please note that this written response should not require any additional research or preparation and should not take you more than one hour to complete.

- What is one business solution to poverty that you think could help improve development outcomes?
- How can an effective, innovative solution from a developing country context be scaled to additional regions/countries to improve standards of living?
- Is international development dead or alive? Why?
- Describe a specific instance where you had to overcome a challenge to achieve your personal or professional goals. What have you learned from this, etc.?

**Notes:**

All offices will only extend offers to candidates looking for full-time positions in the country they complete their program in.  
Employment in all the Dalberg offices is conditional on the candidate having the requisite authorization to live and work in that country.

**Asia: Mumbai and New Delhi offices are able to sponsor work authorization to candidates who require it.**

### Qualifications

Candidates must be full-time graduate students getting an MBA, MPA, MPP, and/or other similar degrees with expected graduation dates of May/June 2024, or May/June 2023 for one-year graduate programs. If you believe you qualify but are unable to click "apply" please email foleya@uchicago.edu with your program and grad date. Candidates should carefully review citizenship requirements for each location prior to submitting application. ### Job Description

**To Apply:**

**Step 1.** Click on "Apply" button above. You MUST apply directly on the firm's website to be considered.  
**Step 2.** Upload your resume to HarrisLink.

\------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Requisition Number: PUBLI006195

**Description**

  
Stifel’s Public Finance professionals perform investment banking services for city, state and local government agencies, helping them raise capital to build and maintain essential infrastructure in the communities they serve. From some of the nation’s largest states, cities, convention centers and economic development projects to rural school districts and small towns and nearly everything in between, our municipal banking and underwriting groups work with public and not-for-profit entities to develop and implement financing strategies that allow them to operate and optimize the important work they do.  
   
In 2021, for the eighth consecutive year, Stifel ranked #1 serving as senior or sole manager for negotiated public municipal bond issues, annually pricing more than one in every ten issues in the nation on a Stifel desk. In 2021, Stifel became the first bank to underwrite more than 1,000 negotiated issues in a single year. Stifel Public Finance has a full scale national presence, and is comprised of about 250 professionals across 36 offices.  
   
Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer and our employees, across all subsidiaries and affiliates, are people with different strengths, experiences and backgrounds, who share a passion for Finance. We view diversity holistically – it includes race, gender identity, age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion, and many other parts of one’s identity. The range of our employees’ points of view are key to our success, and inclusion is everyone's responsibility.

Learn more: https://www.stifel.com/publicfinance

**Position Description: Summer Analyst Program**

  
Stifel’s 9-week Summer Analyst Program provides students with a hands-on introduction to the role of an Analyst. You will work alongside our banking professionals, from Analyst to Managing Director level, and will gain exposure to a variety of public finance transactions and sector types. Interns are expected to work on multiple projects simultaneously, with primary responsibilities in the research and analysis related to transaction generation and execution.

**Responsibilities** 

A Summer Analyst’s specific responsibilities may include conducting industry research, building financial models to analyze outstanding bonds or potential transactions, preparing client presentation materials, and working with banking teams to execute financing transactions.

The primary role of the Summer Analyst includes, but is not limited to:  
·     Analyzing and researching municipal issuers and borrowers in a wide range of sectors (general governmental, K-12, pension, economic development, higher education, etc.)  
·     Conducting industry research and building out industry databases  
·     Preparing presentation materials such as PowerPoint slides and summaries for pitch books  
·     Working with teams to execute financing transactions  
·     Performing in-depth quantitative financial analyses

**Qualifications** 

- Basic understanding of financial industry terminology and concepts.
- Ability to take a problem and research it from beginning to end creating detailed documentation.
- Strong analytical skills focused on using logic, reasoning, and data to identify complex relationships as well as to research and discuss recommended uses.

**Education and Experience**

Summer Analyst candidates should possess outstanding academic records and have demonstrated strong leadership ability through involvement in extracurricular endeavors such as student government, athletics, and cultural and entrepreneurial activities.  
   
The ideal candidate will possess the following:  
·      Strong quantitative/analytical skills  
·      Superior attention to detail  
·      Disciplined work ethic  
·      Excellent verbal and written communication skills  
·      Ability to effectively manage multiple simultaneous project deadlines  
·      Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint  
·      Exposure to finance and accounting and/or quantitative modeling  
·      Experience with financial modeling and analysis preferred  
·      Ability to work in teams  
·      Highly-motivated and energetic  
·      Demonstrated interest in finance and public policy  
·      Minimum GPA of 3.3  
·      An anticipated graduation date of Fall 2023 or Spring 2024

Please note: To be eligible, applicants must be authorized to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship now or in the future.

**About Stifel**

Established in 1890, Stifel is one of the nation’s leading full-service wealth management and investment banking firms. Stifel serves clients from more than 400 offices across the United States and ranks as the nation’s seventh largest full-service investment firm in terms of number of financial advisors. We are also a leading provider of investment banking services to the middle market, a top-ten municipal bond underwriter, and home to one of the industry’s largest research franchises. In addition, our Stifel Bank subsidiary provides a comprehensive range of banking services.  
   
Stifel’s success is rooted in the power of our people and platform. We provide our employees an entrepreneurial environment that rewards collaboration and hard work. We are looking to hire smart, talented, and accepting people who have a desire to expand their skills and realize ambitious goals. We are committed to a diverse workplace that reflects the clients we serve and the communities where we live and work.  
   
At Stifel, we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental, and vision care, 401(k), wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off. The health and safety of our employees and candidates is very important to us. We continue to monitor the current public health situation and have adjusted our hiring procedures to include virtual recruiting tools that allow us to continue meeting new candidates. We look forward to “virtually” meeting you. Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

**NOTE:  The listed close date is an estimate and the organization may review applications on a rolling basis and/or may close the position at any time.   Interested candidates are encouraged to apply ASAP.**

**What to Expect**

Disclaimer: This position is expected to start around May or June 2023 and continue through the entire Summer term (i.e., through August) or into early Fall 2023 if available. We ask for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time, for most internships. Please consider before applying.International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school on your ability to work 40 hours per week before applying. Again, please do not apply until you know you can work 40 hours per week. This is required for external applicants. Many students will be limited to part-time during the academic year.

**Internship Program at Tesla**

The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year around program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We provide an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by giving them projects that are critical to their team’s success. Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla’s mission. 

**About the Team**

This internship will provide opportunities to work with the North American Public Policy & Business Development team on policy and business development, market analysis, and strategic engagement at the state and local level. The incumbent will focus on renewable energy and EV charging policy, public utility regulation, and renewable energy market opportunities, with an opportunity to learn and grow, working across the team to support its full range of efforts.

**What You’ll Do**

As the EV Charging and Energy Public Policy Intern, you’ll gain experience in the following areas:

- Gain breadth and depth of knowledge of regulatory policy issues, including at the state and local level, facing Tesla, with a focus on EV charging, renewable energy generation, storage, permitting and electricity rates regulations.
- Analyze EV charging and energy policy initiatives for their impacts on Tesla
- Support the development of new policy and business initiatives
- Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders

**What You’ll Bring**

- Currently pursuing a graduate or undergraduate degree in relevant field such as Political Science, Public Policy, International Studies, Economics or Business Administration with a focus on energy and sustainability
- Direct experience with energy and/or environmental policy is preferred
- Able to make a 6 month commitment at minimum
- Strong analytical and quantitative skills
- Capable of working in a fast paced and always changing environment
- Capable of working remotely with a high degree of productivity
- Self-starting and solutions oriented
- A strong team player

### Job Description

Company Overview

Morgan Stanley Huaxin Fund Management Co., Ltd. (MSHF) is a Sino-foreign joint venture fund management company in which Morgan Stanley is the largest shareholder. Headquartered in Shenzhen, with branches in Beijing and Shanghai, MSHF provides an array of professionally managed funds for China investors, including fixed income, actively managed equities, fund of funds and separately-managed accounts, with a goal to meet investors’ needs for asset allocation, risk management and investment returns.

About MSHF Research

MSHF Research Management Division is a high-quality investment and research team. The core personnel has rich experience in investment and research. The Research Management Division makes full use of external and internal research resources to provide research results, explore investment opportunities, and provide decision support to investment decision committees and portfolio managers. MSHF Research Management Division adheres to the "top-down" macro industry research and "bottom-up" selected stocks investment philosophy. Based on fundamental analysis, the MSHF Research Management Division continues to grasp the medium - and long-term development trends of the market through forward-looking analysis, balanced asset allocation, and front-end risk prevention.

  
Responsibilities

The roles and responsibilities of Summer Research Analysts vary but may include:

Tracking and analyzing the main industry indicators and related policies  
Creating statistical exhibits that analyze comparative financial performance  
Building models to illustrate projected financial results and value to companies  
Developing marketing memoranda and delivering sections of research presentation

Qualifications, Skills & Requirements

The candidate should be currently pursuing a master's degree or above at a top university (985 or QS Top 100) with a graduation date between October 2023 and July 2024, overseas study experience, STEM education background, etc. are preferred  
The candidate should be ambitious, and self-directed with a strong work ethic and analytical skills (both quantitative and qualitative)  
He/she will be passionately interested in a career in finance, intellectually curious, and eager to learn. We are seeking an academically accomplished candidate with the ability to multitask and work under stress  
The candidate should possess excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Mandarin and English  
Skilled in using MS Office and databases such as Wind/Bloomberg/CIQ

Application Process and Deadline

  
We review applications on a rolling basis, so we advise you to apply as soon as you are ready. The application deadline is 31 December 2022, 23:55 CST.

Close relatives1 of ADB staff, except spouses of international staff, are not eligible for recruitment and appointment to staff positions. Applicants are expected to disclose if they have any relative/s by consanguinity/blood, by adoption and/or by affinity/marriage presently employed in ADB.

Staff on probation are not eligible to apply. Applicants for promotion must have served at their position for at least one year and must have normally served at their personal level for at least two years immediately preceding the date of the vacancy closing date. Applicants for lateral transfer must have served at their position and personal level for at least one year immediately preceding the date of the vacancy closing date (reference A.O. 2.03, paragraphs 5.8 and 5.9).

**Overview**  
Asian Development Bank (ADB) is an international development finance institution headquartered in Manila, Philippines and is composed of 68 members, 49 of which are from the Asia and Pacific region. ADB is committed to achieving a prosperous, inclusive, resilient, and sustainable Asia and the Pacific, while sustaining its efforts to eradicate extreme poverty.  ADB combines finance, knowledge, and partnerships to fulfill its expanded vision under its Strategy 2030.  
 

ADB only hires nationals of its 68 members: [https://www.adb.org/who-we-are/about#members](https://www.adb.org/who-we-are/about#members)

To view ADB Organizational Chart, please click here: [https://www.adb.org/who-we-are/organization](https://www.adb.org/who-we-are/organization)

The Young Professionals Program (YPP) is an entry-level recruitment program to attract highly qualified and motivated individuals to ADB. The YPP provides the foundation for a challenging and rewarding professional career in an international development environment and offers a range of opportunities to develop professional skills and understanding of ADB’s operations, policies and procedures and contribute to the achievement of ADB’s Strategy 2030. 

**Job Purpose**   
As a Young Professional, you will contribute to ADB's mission and execution of main instruments comprising loans, technical assistance (TA), grants, advice, and knowledge. You will report to the Director or designated International Staff and may supervise National Staff and Administrative Staff.  
   
**Responsibilities**  
a. Strategy and Planning

- Assist and participate towards the development of policy and strategy of ADB.
- Apply own complex specialist knowledge to support others in research and analysis including development impact of ADB operations.

  
b. Project Management

- Assist and participate in the development, processing, and administration of non-complex loans, grants and/or TA projects.
- Support integration of ADB’s policies and guidelines in the design and implementation of projects.

c. Knowledge Sharing

- Support and contribute to ADB’s activities for advocacy, dissemination, and knowledge building.

**Qualifications**  
 Relevant Experience & Requirements

- A University degree in Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Engineering, Environment, Law, Social Sciences, Public Policy, or other areas relevant to ADB’s operations. A post-graduate level degree or its equivalent is preferred.
- At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in any of the following fields: macro or development economics, climate change, commercial/investment banking or corporate investment, education, energy, environment, financial sector, public health, public-private partnership, rural development, transport, urban planning, water operations, and agriculture and natural resources. PhD will be considered in lieu of work experience.
- International experience in areas related to ADB operations will be an asset.
- Not more than 32 years old upon joining ADB.
- Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.
- Please refer to the link for ADB Competency Framework for International Staff level IS1.

**Selection Process**  
If you are interested, we encourage you to submit your application on or before the advertisement deadline. Shortlisted applicants will be invited for a virtual preliminary interview and written assessment in December. If successful, you will be invited for a panel interview and technical presentation in January 2023.

**Application Checklist**  
Upload the following documents in the “Attachments” section of your application:

- Curriculum vitae (CV)
- Research/policy paper (Max. of 25 pages)
- Most recent university transcript

**Benefits**

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package which includes:

- 26 days of annual leave
- Sick leave
- Up to 26 calendar weeks of parental leave
- Rental allowance (if applicable)
- Installation Allowance (if applicable)
- Education allowance for your dependent children (if applicable)
- Home country travel (if applicable)
- Medical insurance
- Retirement Benefits
- Learning and development opportunities, etc.
- General Considerations

*The selected candidate is appointed for an initial term of 3 years.* 

ADB seeks to ensure that everyone is treated with respect and given equal opportunities to work in an inclusive environment. ADB encourages all qualified candidates to apply regardless of their racial, ethnic, religious, and cultural background, gender, sexual orientation, or disabilities. Women are highly encouraged to apply.  
 

   
Primary Location: Asian Development Bank-Asian Development Bank Headquarters-Philippines-Manila  
Department: Budget, People, and Management Systems Department  
Division: HR Business Partners Division  
Staff Category: International Staff (HQ)  
Position Level: IS 1  
Job Posting: 17-Oct-2022, 3:24:58 AM  
Closing Date (Period for Applying) - Internal: 15-Nov-2022, 8:59:00 AM

## Your role

Want to work at one of the world’s leading financial services firms? You’ll:  
• gain invaluable hands-on experience working with business experts  
• work on cross-business projects with stakeholders from across the bank  
• learn technical skills  
• attend induction seminars and on-the-job trainings  
• join networking sessions to get to know your peers and expand your network  
• develop your skill set through interactive, informative sessions  

## Your team
You’ll be working in Global Markets, looking after professional investors like asset managers and fund managers. With the goal to achieve premium client service, you’ll support your team drawing on the strength of our platform, products, services and people worldwide.

Diversity helps us grow, together. That’s why we're committed to fostering and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion. It strengthens our business and brings value to our clients.  
Your expertise

You need to be graduating by July 2024.

It doesn’t matter what you’re studying. (Really, it doesn’t!) But we’d like to see evidence that you can:  
• analyze a problem, take a view and come to a decision  
• plan, organize and communicate well  
• make things happen  
• stick with a task  
• work in a team  
• come up with ideas

Perhaps you’ve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or persevered and passed an exam in a subject you found challenging? Think about how things you’ve achieved match the skills we’re after.  

## Your Program
Be a real part of the team on this 10-week summer program. Work with our experts and learn about the industry, our clients, our firm and a specific area of it. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to develop new skills and make contacts. And if you impress us, we might invite you to join our Graduate Talent Program once you’ve graduated.

You can only apply for one program in one country within Asia Pacific during the same academic year.  

## About us
UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?  

## Join us
At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?  

## Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Employees working from UBS Hong Kong offices must present proof of vaccination for at least the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine or a medical exemption certificate before entering the workplace, and other applicable anti-epidemic measures as may be amended from time to time.

2023 Analytics & Sales Summer Internship Programme, Shanghai

https://harris-uchicago-csm.symplicity.com/students/app/jobs/detail/46d5d50fdaa703fa2712380870d37121?expired=1	

### Job Description

You have an understanding of the drivers behind market moving stories and events. You're a solution-finder, with a real passion for providing exceptional customer service in a fast-paced environment. With a desire to build a career in a client-facing role, you understand the importance of credibility and building relationships. Join our comprehensive Analytics & Sales summer internship program, where you will rotate between both departments over the course of ten weeks, gaining an insight into what our graduate role has to offer!

  
What is the role?  
You will start with a week of classroom based financial product and functionality training, to broaden your knowledge of the global financial markets and our market leading Bloomberg solutions. After your training, you'll join a team where you'll immediately begin collaborating with interns on Analytics and Sales projects.

  
You'll have the opportunity to interact with clients, making valuable contributions by taking part in sales campaigns, promoting product features and prospecting for new business. Hands-on individual and group projects will allow you to experience how your full-time career could evolve.

  
To round out your experience, you'll attend lunch and learn sessions, designed to teach you about our diversified group, and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet Bloomberg leaders at a variety of networking events. Of course we also want to give you the chance to get to know your peers, so you'll also take part in volunteering activities and social events with interns from other departments.

  
Analytics  
We provide 24/7 support for Bloomberg Professional Service users all over the world and across multiple industries. Reaching us via our 'Instant Bloomberg' chat system, clients access unparalleled customer service where we answer their questions and help them maximise the value of Bloomberg's products. On any given day we respond to over 12,000 queries in more than 15 languages. From educating a portfolio manager on Bloomberg’s risk management solutions to helping a trader use our functionality to discover new sources of market liquidity – the variety of problems we solve is immense.

  
Bloomberg is constantly innovating and Analytics plays a key role in ensuring clients are educated on new products and enhancements by proactively working closely to upskill them through technology, and delivering on-site training and seminars. We also work in conjunction with Enterprise Sales to deliver on strategic initiatives, supporting product roll-out and onboarding clients. We want to ensure our clients are making the most of our service and using tools and features that allow them to work smarter.

  
Sales  
In Sales, we're the face of Bloomberg for our clients. Consultative and entrepreneurial, we manage client relationships, whilst striving to continually grow our revenue by identifying new business opportunities.

  
We spend our time with our clients, understanding their business goals and outpacing their expectations. Guided by curiosity and purpose, we work to understand their workflows and present them with the most appropriate solutions across our range of enterprise offerings.

  
We’re discovering new business leads by making prospecting calls and networking. We demonstrate how Bloomberg's product offering will help our clients make the best investment/trading/business decisions, making their day to day business smoother and more profitable.

  
You’ll need to have:  
 A demonstrable interest in the financial markets and the aspiration to work in the financial services industry  
 Real ambition to pursue a client-facing career, with a strong interest in relationship management and sales  
 A customer service and solution focused mindset with a high degree of interpersonal skills  
 Stakeholder management exposure through school or work/internship  
 Strong critical-thinking and problem-solving skills  
 The resilience to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic environment  
 Ability to communicate effectively and articulate thought process clearly  
 Fluency in English and Mandarin (Written and Verbal)  
We'd love to see:  
 Work experience in a client facing role  
 Interest in technology  
You need to be:  
 Currently enrolled in a university with a graduation date between November 2023 and July 2024  
 Able to start full-time work by August 2024  
 Available to work for the whole duration of 10 weeks between 16 June to 25 August 2023  
 At a minimum, we require that you are legally authorized to work full-time in mainland China and will not require visa sponsorship now or in the future  
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloombergchina.com/company/

  
Please note this is a two-stage application process, following the submission of your candidate details you will receive an email with directions to complete an online assessment. Your application will not be complete until you have submitted the assessment.

  
Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

  
Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for the recruitment process. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email apac\_recruit@bloomberg.net.
notes:
2023 Analytics & Sales Summer Internship, Shanghai


Launching your career or making a move? Make it happen here. We have roles across wide-ranging businesses and products for you to explore.

## Description & Requirements

Our Analytics & Sales six-week summer internship is designed for those in their penultimate year of study and will provide insight and hands-on experiences into both our Analytics and Sales departments. Through trainings, projects, networking opportunities and more, you will gain a comprehensive understanding of our Bloomberg products and clients in the wider context of financial markets. The internship is an integral part of gaining insight into our graduate role. The goal would be for interns to work full-time the following year as we align on your skillset and interests throughout the program 

Our Analytics department provides 24/7 support for Bloomberg Professional Service users all over the world and across multiple industries. Reaching us via our Helpdesk using the 'Instant Bloomberg' chat system, clients access unparalleled customer service where we answer their questions and help them maximize the value of Bloomberg's products. On any given day we respond to over 12,000 queries in more than 15 languages. From- educating a portfolio manager on Bloomberg’s risk management solutions to helping a trader use our functionality to discover new sources of market liquidity – the variety of problems we solve is immense.  

Bloomberg is constantly innovating, and Analytics plays a key role in ensuring clients are educated on new products and enhancements by proactively working closely to upskill them through technology and delivering on-site training and seminars. We also work in conjunction with Sales to deliver strategic initiatives, supporting product roll-out and onboarding clients. We want to ensure our clients are making the most of our service and using tools and features that allow them to work smarter.  

In Sales, we are the face of Bloomberg for our clients. Consultative and entrepreneurial, we manage client relationships, whilst striving to continually grow our revenue by identifying new business opportunities. We spend our time with our clients, understanding their business goals and outpacing their expectations. Guided by curiosity and purpose, we work to understand their workflows and present them with the most appropriate solutions across our range of enterprise offerings.  

What is the role? 

You will start with a week of classroom based financial product and functionality training, to broaden your knowledge of the global financial markets and our market leading Bloomberg solutions. After your training, you'll join a team where you'll immediately begin collaborating with interns on Analytics and Sales projects. 

You'll have the opportunity to interact with clients, making valuable contributions by taking part in sales campaigns, promoting product features, and prospecting for new business. Hands-on individual and group projects will allow you to experience how your full-time career could evolve.  

To round out your experience, you'll attend learning sessions, designed to teach you about our diversified group, and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet Bloomberg leaders at a variety of networking events. Of course we also want to give you the chance to get to know your peers, so you'll also take part in volunteering activities and social events with interns from other departments.  

This is an entry level role where you’ll need to be: 

- Currently enrolled in university (undergraduate or postgraduate), and completing all studies between December 2022 and September 2023
- Available to work for the whole duration of 6 weeks between 4 August to 12 September, 2023

You’ll need to have:  

- Demonstrated interest in the financial markets and the aspiration to work in the financial services industry
- Strong multitasking abilities, critical thinking and problem-solving skills
- The ability to learn and adapt quickly in a fast-paced dynamic environment
- Ambition for a client-facing career
- Exceptional communication skills (both written and verbal)
- Fluency in Japanese, in addition to English (written and verbal)

We’d love to see:  

- Demonstrated interest in and/or exposure to the practical application of Python, however not a prerequisite to apply
- Previous experience in client relationship management
- Beginner to intermediate experience with Excel and/or VBA

  

  If this sounds like you:  

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at: [https://www.bloomberg.com/company/.](https://www.bloomberg.com/company/%20.)

jobDescription:
2023 Securities Sales Summer Analyst Program

https://harris-uchicago-csm.symplicity.com/students/app/jobs/detail/e57850a284bd32ee885ee9da62dc00ab?expired=1	

### Job Description

Company Overview  
Morgan Stanley Securities (China) Co., Ltd. is Morgan Stanley’s securities business platform in China, and provides leading financial services to its clients in the People’s Republic of China and across the globe. Our businesses include underwriting and sponsoring of equities and bonds, proprietary trading of bonds (including government bonds and corporate bonds), as well as other businesses approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC). With headquarter in Shanghai, the company also has a branch in Beijing and an office in Shenzhen.

Division Overview  
Securities Sales Division (SSD) is a leading group in sales across the market, and responsible for the sales work of equities (including IPO, private placement, CB, EB, etc.), bonds (including government bonds, corporate bonds, etc.). SSD integrates expertise in GCM and Investment Banking, offering clients seamless advice and sophisticated solutions. The Group work closely with Chief Investment Officers, Portfolio Managers, and Traders to deliver meaningful market insight and expertise, and to help clients successfully achieve their investment objectives.

Training program  
Summer Analysts experience the culture and atmosphere of Morgan Stanley Securities (China) by taking on responsibilities of a Full Time Analyst for approximately 10 weeks. Summer Analysts are exposed to the deal process: including client development, investment ideas presentation and the fundamentals of sales work, and will gain an understanding of how the different areas of the sales interact.  
Summer Analysts will work alongside experienced employees to learn how we build our client base and establish and maintain long-term client relationships. Assist with developing and presenting investment ideas and the fundamentals of selling and cross-selling the Firm’s products.

Responsibilities  
• Over the course of the 10- week program you will participate in projects to help build a foundation of communication skills and a solid understanding of the markets.  
• You will have a mentor and buddy to aid in your development and to provide greater exposure to SSD and the Firm.  
• You will be encouraged to take on responsibility quickly and help bridge various topics from new trends in the marketplace to group overviews.

Qualifications/ Skills/ Requirements  
• You are pursuing an undergraduate Bachelor’s or Master's degree with a graduation date between October 2023 and July 2024  
• Possess basic knowledge of and a keen interest in finance  
• Analytical, adaptive, multi-tasker, team player and have a strong work ethic and leadership skills  
• Fluent in Mandarin and English, both verbal and written  
• Skilled in using MS Office and databases such as Wind/Bloomberg/CIQ

Application Process and Deadline  
We review applications on a rolling basis, so we advise you to apply as soon as you are ready. Application processes may vary by location but typical follow:  
• CV Review  
• Phone Interview  
• Superday (Face-to-face interview)

Internship, Asset Management

https://harris-uchicago-csm.symplicity.com/students/app/jobs/detail/e92570becb9088850255f9781cb256fc?expired=1	

### Job Description

Your role

Do you want to learn all about asset management? You’ll:  
• know our China strategy and participate into our business development here  
• have a solid understanding of the front to back processes and risks of an Asset Manager  
• help us to build and deepen our distribution network with UBS Global Wealth Management in China and assist our day-to-day sales and marketing activities  
• have chance to learn about our investment capabilities  
• interact and work with our internal partners to implement our sales strategies  
Your team

You’ll work in Asset Management, helping to manage large-scale assets with well-diversified businesses across regions, capabilities and distribution channels. You’ll be a part of one of the leading fund houses in Europe, the largest mutual fund manager in Switzerland, and one of the largest fund of hedge funds and real estate investment managers in the world. We are a team full of energy, and well-equipped with knowledge to deal with the challenge every day in China!

Diversity helps us grow, together. That’s why we are committed to fostering and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion. It strengthens our business and brings value to our clients.  
Your expertise

You need to be graduating by July 2024, or with less than two years of work experience. It doesn’t matter what you’re studying. (Really, it doesn’t.) But we’d like to see evidence that you can:  
• analyze a problem, take a view and come to a decision  
• plan, organize and communicate well  
• make things happen  
• stick with a task  
• work in a team  
• come up with ideas

Perhaps you’ve organized a fundraising event or taken part in team sports? Or persevered and passed an exam in a subject you found challenging? Think about how things you’ve achieved match the skills we’re after.  
Your Program

Be a real part of the team on this 10-week summer program. Work with our experts and learn about the industry, our clients, our firm and a specific area of it. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to develop new skills and make contacts. And if you impress us, we might invite you to join our Graduate Talent Program once you’ve graduated.

You can only apply for one program in one country within Asia Pacific during the same academic year.  
About us

UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?  
Join us

At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?  
Disclaimer / Policy Statements

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Employees working from UBS Hong Kong offices must present proof of vaccination for at least the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine or a medical exemption certificate before entering the workplace, and other applicable anti-epidemic measures as may be amended from time to time.

Investment Banking Analyst Program

https://harris-uchicago-csm.symplicity.com/students/app/jobs/detail/103fd288089ddfccb62bc5adcfdb38f2?expired=1	

### Job Description

Drive the future of global finance  
Investment banking teams partner with corporate clients to achieve their strategic goals. Whether it is raising capital for an expansion or buying another company, investment bankers provide innovative and creative financial solutions for all clients’ needs. We’re looking for analytical thinkers who thrive on building long-term relationships. You’ll be part of a global, fast-paced team that does business with more than 90% of Fortune 500 companies.

Get a taste of life as an investment banker at J.P. Morgan through our Investment Banking Virtual Experience Program on Forage. This program will give you insights into the different creative financial solutions that we provide to our clients and what it takes to be an investment banking in J.P. Morgan. To learn more and register, visit Forage.

What you'll do

This nine-week program starts with virtual training, followed by five days of classroom instruction on accounting fundamentals, financial modeling, valuation, and Excel. Through hands-on experience and ongoing education, you’ll develop core investment banking skills to help support our clients’ businesses while launching your career in the industry. You’ll benefit from direct exposure on deals and transactions and interact with clients and teams globally.

Who we are looking for

Valued qualities

We value diversity of thought, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives and we’re looking for those who have innovative ideas, entrepreneurial qualities, and enjoy tackling new challenges and solving intellectual problems.

We’re looking for motivated, resourceful, analytical people who are ready to make a contribution from the beginning. If you have exceptional interpersonal and communication skills and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, then this is the role for you.

   
Key skills

We’re looking for excellent problem solving, organization and communications skills. You need to have strict attention to detail, be a quick learner, and enjoy working in an ever-changing, fast-paced environment. We need flexible and adaptable, analytical people who bring a comprehensive knowledge of global markets and a strong interest in financial services.

What we offer

Our bankers are focused on developing long-term relationships and crafting strategies that help our clients grow and innovate. We provide sound advice, offer clients access funding, and execute transactions, all while helping clients manage risks in today’s complex environment.

We work across teams to bring comprehensive solutions to clients’ challenges, allowing them to achieve their objectives and remain competitive across global markets. Our industry and product teams include: Consumer & Retail, Corporate Finance Advisory, Diversified Industries, Energy, Equity Capital Markets, Financial Institutions, Financial Sponsors, Healthcare, Investment Grade Finance, Latin America Advisory, Leveraged Finance, Media & Communications, Mergers & Acquisitions, Public Finance, Real Estate, Gaming & Lodging, Regional Investment Banking, and Technology.

   
On-the-job experience

You’ll join one of our industry or product groups for nine weeks, developing meaningful solutions for clients or executing high-value transactions. This program will provide the skills and experience to become a thoughtful, strategic advisor. You’ll learn the nature of client service and how we build long-term relationships by putting their needs first, while developing the technical acumen to launch a career in banking.

   
Training

You’ll begin with a week of training to understand our products, services and business practices. We provide supplemental training before you start and throughout the course of the summer as well as extensive on-the-job training. You’ll develop your professional network through various opportunities to interact with people from across the business as well as other interns. We’ll pair you with mentors to help you navigate the firm as well as provide career advice and make sure you’re developing your skills.

   
Career Progression

Top performing interns may receive an offer to join us as a full-time analyst at the end of the summer.

https://harris-uchicago-csm.symplicity.com/students/app/jobs/detail/cf802f700c8fa831b10252cf5a9fd087?expired=1	

### Job Description

Launch the next wave of cash management and payment solutions.  
Help drive innovation across global payments and be at the forefront of innovation. Our program puts you at the lead of executing comprehensive client solutions for multinational corporates, financial institutions, and public sector clients.

What you'll do

You’ll learn what it means to move money in this nine-week program. You’ll interact with clients and internal partners while experiencing our commitment to excellence in client service.

Who we are looking for

Valued qualities

A self-starter with  a collaborative mindset and willingness to partner and work in a team; enthusiasm, energy, and a drive to succeed; steady focus, innovative approach, exceptional service, and execution.

Key skills

Creative problem-solving abilities both on your own and with a team; exceptional analytical, research and project management skills; familiarity with business fundamentals.

What we offer

On-the-job experience

You’ll gain hands-on experience in large scale payments and corporate financial institutions that help make money move. The Payments program offers you the opportunity to gain experience by helping develop presentations, completing analyses, pricing and cash flows, and conducting client due diligence. You’ll build your technical skills and knowledge of the financial service industry, incorporating emerging technologies based on a holistic view of the payments landscape.

Training

Kick off the summer with one week of finance fundamentals training, followed by product specific and supplemental instruction. Access to senior management and a strong network of peers will promote ongoing professional development throughout the summer.

Career Progression

From day one you will start to build your network while sharpening your technical skills and knowledge of cash management and payment solutions. Top performing summer analysts may receive a full-time offer to join the two year Payments rotational analyst program. Rotational analysts are positioned to place out into a full-time role within the company.

Markets Summer Analyst Program

https://harris-uchicago-csm.symplicity.com/students/app/jobs/detail/f951b5bcb4d1d9609f1508f5bbb7fc1f?expired=1	

### Job Description

Become an expert in financial markets  
Become an expert in financial markets while working in a dynamic, collaborative and supportive team when you join our sales, trading and research group. You’ll research and find exciting opportunities for our clients, help them execute complex transactions and develop deep relationships while gaining a thorough understanding of markets through data analysis.

Sales, trading and research work collaboratively to help clients achieve their goals. The sales team is in touch with institutional clients about insights and strategic ideas that are executed by traders. All of this is informed by comprehensive research into financial markets and companies that allows us to give the best possible advice.

Get a taste of what it is like to be part of our dynamic Markets teams at J.P. Morgan through our Markets Virtual Experience Program on Forage. This program will help build your skillset and provide unique insight into the different roles in the team. To learn more and register, visit Forage.

What you'll do

Working on one of our dynamic teams, your day-to-day will vary based on your team and what’s going on in the markets. You will use your passion and critical thinking skills to solve real business problems, innovate new client offerings outside of our traditional products, work on complex mathematical models and cutting-edge methodologies, collaborate with our development teams using machine learning techniques, and analyze data to come up with innovative insights for clients.

You’ll also write reports, build updated financial models, and support multi-billion dollar transactions.

Who we are looking for

Valued qualities

We’re looking for inquisitive, creative thinkers who can react quickly to changing markets. Our teams need a diversity of thought to be successful, so we’re looking for people with different backgrounds, degrees and experiences. Those who work well in teams and are able to build long-term relationships with colleagues and clients do well here.

   
Key skills

You must have strong critical thinking and communication skills along with excellent analytical, quantitative and interpersonal skills. You’ll need to be able to work independently and with our teams to produce accurate, detailed work under pressure. Interest in financial markets is a plus.

What we offer

As a summer intern, you will help provide and analyze the information needed to create the right solutions for our internal and external clients. You’ll learn about global market strategies and asset classes through ongoing education and hands-on experience. You will be a critical part of the team you join.

   
On-the-job experience

You’ll gain experience in proposing trade ideas as a part of a “desk” or conduct research in a specific sector team. You’ll learn about the solutions, products and insights we offer clients in any market conditions. You will regularly attend meetings, give presentations and be evaluated for your market thoughts as part of the team.

   
Training

You’ll kick off the summer with online training followed by four days of classroom training. During your internship you’ll also have access to mentors and our ongoing speaker series and you will take part in regular trading simulations.

   
Career Progression

The program is an opportunity to take your career to the next level through unique experiences, relevant skills training and valuable professional networking. Top performing interns may receive a full-time offer and entry into our widely recognized, industry leading, full-time training program expanding upon what you learned in your internship. This intense training program covers both classroom and on-the-job components. Our unique tutor program helps new full-time Analysts acclimatize to the J.P. Morgan culture while putting the learned concepts and theories into practice and business applications.
